title: Our Five Senses

vocab.definition: Using your eyes to see things
Using your ears to hear sounds
Using your nose to smell things
Using your tongue to taste food
Using your skin to feel things
Body parts we use to hear
Body parts we use to see

teachingNotes: Use sensory exploration activities. Taste and smell safely with supervision. Connect senses to body parts. Practice describing sensations.

sample.question: Which sense do you use to see a rainbow?
What body part do you use to hear?
How do you know if something smells good?
What sense tells you if food tastes sweet?
How can you tell if something is rough or smooth?

truefalse.question: We use our nose to smell.
Our ears help us see things.
expectedAny: ears are for hearing, eyes for seeing

truefalse.question: We have five senses.
expectedAny: five senses: sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch

truefalse.question: Your tongue helps you hear sounds.
Touch lets you feel if things are hot or cold.
You can taste with your eyes.
expectedAny: eyes are for seeing, not tasting

truefalse.question: All five senses help us learn about the world.

multiplechoice.question: What do we use to hear music?
Which sense helps you enjoy the smell of flowers?
What body part is used for the sense of sight?
How do you know if food is salty?
Which sense tells you if something feels bumpy?
What helps you hear a bird singing?
Which sense do you use to see colors?

fillintheblank.question: We use our _____ to taste food.
Our _____ help us see things around us.
When we _____ something, we learn how it feels.
The five senses are sight, hearing, smell, taste, and _____.
Your _____ can tell you if something tastes good.

shortanswer.question: Name something you can touch that feels soft.
What sounds do you like to hear?
Describe something that smells good to you.
What is your favorite thing to look at?
Name a food that tastes sweet.
How do your senses help you every day?
expectedAny: I use them all the time

shortanswer.question: Which sense would you use to enjoy a garden?

wordProblems.question: Sarah uses 3 senses when she eats an apple: she sees it, tastes it, and feels it. How many senses is she using?
There are 5 senses total. If Tommy is using his eyes and ears, how many more senses could he also use?
In the garden, Maria can see 4 flowers, smell 3 of them, and touch 2 of them. How many flowers did she experience with her senses?
expectedAny: she experienced the same flowers with different senses

wordProblems.question: Ben tastes 2 different foods and hears 3 different sounds. How many different sensory experiences is that?
If each person has 5 senses and there are 4 children in the group, how many senses do they have altogether?
Amy closes her eyes, so she can't use her sight. How many senses can she still use?
During snack time, Jake uses 4 of his 5 senses. How many senses is he not using?
